intro: Phanera riedeliana, commonly known as the Riedel's phanera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in rainforests. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
